Annotation.String: This enum describes all Protocols supported by devices in the Storage and Fabric models.
PCI Express.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the PCI-SIG PCI Express Base Specification.
Advanced Host Controller Interface.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Intel Advanced Host Controller Interface Specification.
Universal Host Controller Interface.

This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Intel Universal Host Controller Interface Specification, Enhanced Host Controller Interface Specification, or the Extensible Host Controller Interface specification.
Serial Attached SCSI.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the T10 SAS Protocol Layer Specification.
Serial AT Attachment.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Serial ATA International Organization Serial ATA Specification.
Universal Serial Bus.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the USB Implementers Forum Universal Serial Bus Specification.
Non-Volatile Memory Express.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Non-Volatile Memory Host Controller Interface Specification Specification.
Fibre Channel.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the T11 Fibre Channel Physical and Signaling Interface Specification.
Internet SCSI.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the IETF Internet Small Computer Systems Interface (iSCSI) Specification.
Fibre Channel over Ethernet.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the T11 FC-BB-5 Specification.
Fibre Channel Protocol for SCSI.
This enumeration literal shall indicate the INCITS 481: Information technology - Fibre Channel Protocol for SCSI. The Fibre Channel SCSI Protocol.
FIbre CONnection (FICON).

This enumeration literal shall indicate the (ANSI FC-SB-3 Single-Byte Command Code Sets-3 Mapping Protocol for the Fibre Channel(FC) protocol. FICON (FIbre CONnection) is the IBM proprietary name for this protocol.
NVMe over Fabrics.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the NVM Express over Fabrics Specification.
Server Message Block (aka CIFS Common Internet File System).
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Microsoft Server Message Block Protocol.
Network File System version 3.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Network File System protocol as defined by RFC 1813.
Network File System version 4.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Network File System protocol as defined by RFC 3010 or RFC 5661.
Hypertext Transport Protocol.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Hypertext Transfer protocol as defined by RFC 2068 or RFC 2616.
Secure Hypertext Transport Protocol.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the Hypertext Transfer protocol as defined by RFC 2068 or RFC 2616 utilizing Transport Layer Security as specified by RFC 5246 or RFC 6176.
File Transfer Protocol.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the File Transfer protocol as defined by RFC 114.
Secure File Transfer Protocol.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the File Transfer protocol as defined by RFC 114 utilizing Transport Layer Security as specified by RFC 5246 or RFC 6176.
Internet Wide Area Remote Direct Memory Access Protocol.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the iWARP protocol as defined by RFC 5042 utilizing Transport Layer mechanisms as specified by RFC 5043 or RFC 5044.
RDMA over Converged Ethernet Protocol.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the RDMA over Converged Ethernet protocol as defined by the Infiniband Architecture Specification.
RDMA over Converged Ethernet Protocol Version 2.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the RDMA over Converged Ethernet version 2 protocol as defined by the Infiniband Architecture Specification.
Inter-Integrated Circuit Bus.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to the NXP Semiconductors I2C-bus Specification.
OEM specific.
This value shall mean that this device conforms to an OEM specific architecture and additional information may be included in the OEM section.
